image.altText: England batter Joe Root looks over his shoulder after playing a shot in the Ashes.

items.synopsis: Former England captain Joe Root is charging towards his fourth Ashes century on the first day of the first Ashes Test at Edgbaston.Â Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Joe Root leads the way on day one of the Ashes

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Wow that was not great from Moeen Ali. He took a massive heave after a long, random run down the pitch, and was easily stumped. Horrible. He goes for an 17-ball 18
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Stumped! Moeen is out!

children.content: Wow that was not great from Moeen Ali.
He took a massive heave after a long, random run down the pitch, and was easily stumped.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Bairstow was just getting going, really getting his groove and he charged Lyon's ball, missed it completely, and was stumped by Carey. He departs for a run-a-ball 78 and the 121-run partnership is over.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: STUMPED HIM! BAIRSTOW GOES!

children.content: Bairstow was just getting going, really getting his groove and he charged Lyon's ball, missed it completely, and was stumped by Carey.
He departs for a run-a-ball 78 and the 121-run partnership is over.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The start of that session was all Australia, with the wickets of Harry Brook and Ben Stokes in quick succession adding to the pre-lunch scalp of Zak Crawley. But Joe Root is looking in imperious form, and now Jonny Bairstow's getting into his work. This partnership could do just about anything, so the Aussie bowlers can't let up at all in the final session.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Tea: England 5-240 (Root 66, Bairstow 33)

props.alt: England batter Jonny Bairstow hits a powerful cricket shot.

children.content: The start of that session was all Australia, with the wickets of Harry Brook and Ben Stokes in quick succession adding to the pre-lunch scalp of Zak Crawley.

But Joe Root is looking in imperious form, and now Jonny Bairstow's getting into his work. This partnership could do just about anything, so the Aussie bowlers can't let up at all in the final session.

image.altText: A head and shoulder shot of Barry Cable standing in a courtyard.

items.synopsis: Barry Cable is ordered to pay $800,000 after a judge finds he groomed and sexually abused a young girl, starting when she was aged just 12, with sexual contact and harassment continuing for decades until the woman was in her mid-30s.

title.children: Woman unlikely to receive any money after judge finds she was sexually abused by Barry Cable

image.altText: Female hands holding a mobile phone with a dark background.

items.synopsis: Claire Harrison says she's still recovering from losing her identity and tens of thousands of dollarsÂ by mobile porting fraud, where scammers port your mobile number to anotherÂ device.

title.children: 'Terrifying' phone porting scam stealing millions but cybersecurity experts say it's unavoidable

image.altText: Nathanial Bradford welding wearing safety gear at his workplace as his TAFE teacher Ronald Dyer looks on wearing safety glasses.

items.synopsis: Premier Roger Cook pays tribute to a 16-year-old boy killed in an accident at his workplace in Perth yesterday, as the Worksafe commissioner warns of ongoing employee safety risks from labour shortages and supply chain complexities.

title.children: WA Premier speaks of 'tragic' teenage workplace death amid warning of continuing risks for employees

image.altText: A bald man in a suit and glasses walks in the Senate chamber.

items.synopsis: Senator David Van's future in the Liberal Party will be decided at an urgent meeting of the Victorian branch on the weekend.

title.children: Liberal Party's Victorian branch to decide David Van's future at weekend meeting

image.altText: Liberal Senator David Van

items.synopsis: Two women ended up in tears in the Senate this week, as the Brittany Higgins imbroglio exploded yet again and in the process claimed a scalp, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: A spectacular fall as Liberals chase the uncatchable

image.altText: A large white church is pictured with men in suits walking in front of it carrying candles.

title.children: Explosions rattle Kyiv as African leaders on peace mission visit Ukraine

image.altText: A house with a sold sign out the front.

items.synopsis: A couple bought the home in 2018 at a mortgagee auction, but after a five-year legalÂ battle foundÂ they never actually owned it. Today, it sold for more than double the previous sale price.

title.children: Gold Coast house at centre of complex legal dispute over ownership sells for $2.66m at auction

image.altText: A winding road in the community, surrounded by houses and power poles.

items.synopsis: Inadequate training led a Northern Territory police officerÂ to recommend a dangerous domestic violence offender be released on bail three days before he killed his partner, the NT coroner has heard.

title.children: Police officer apologises for recommending bail for DV offender days before killing, inquest hears

items.synopsis: Initial reports indicate six people were on board, with four being taken to local clinics in serious conditions.

title.children: Plane crashes while attempting to land on Groote Eylandt

items.synopsis: A McDonald's manager who was punched and spat on by a customer tells the Adelaide Magistrates Court he still has flashbacks of the incident and has to attend therapy sessions.

title.children: 'Absolutely disgusted': Victims of McDonald's 'rampage' tell court of trauma

image.altText: A man with a hat stands on top of a rock

image.altText: Picture of a sign saying caution with an open pit coal mine and power station in the background

image.altText: A black and white photo of a topless person from their right side.

image.altText: A woman in a high vis vest standing near a group of similarly dressed people.

items.synopsis: Applicants for permanent Business Innovation and Investment Programme (BIIP) visas, or subclass 888 visas, hold demonstrations in Sydney and Melbourne, calling for the government to speed up processing of their permanent residency.

title.children: 'A matter of fairness': 'Golden ticket' visa holders protest against permanent residency processing time

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman stands behind the podium in the White House's press briefing room, gesturing as she speaks.

items.synopsis: The new victims add to a growing list of entities in the US, Britain and other countries whose systems were infiltrated through the MOVEit Transfer software.

image.altText: A young Brisbane Lions AFL player kicks the ball towards goal as a Sydney defender trails behind him.

image.altText: Four young children smiling and laughing

title.children: Ex-husband of woman who died alongside four children in truck crash says he feels 'no purpose in life anymore'

image.altText: A jawless fish showing its oral disc and teeth.

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

title.children: These employers have introduced four-day work weeks and 'can't think of a downside'

items.synopsis: The first woman to be the chief justice of the High Court, Susan Kiefel announces her early retirement from the highest court in the land.Â

title.children: Trailblazing justice Susan Kiefel to retire early from the High Court

image.altText: Sign for Brisbane Supreme and District Court buildings.

title.children: Man who burned ex-girlfriend's new partner with 'improvised flamethrower' given immediate parole

image.altText: A middle-aged man with one eye swollen shut, a cut on his nose and eye bruising. He is wearing a neck brace.

items.synopsis: Jim Cullen's ordeal was not over when help finally arrived after a crash in the NT that left his mates fearing for his life. Rather than an emergency airlift,Â he then had to endure a 60km trip along a rough dirt road to an airstrip.

image.altText: A scan of a photo shows Florence Charleston holding a baby

items.synopsis: How Florence Charleston wound up dead and buried in a shallow grave hundreds of kilometres from her home remains a mystery.

title.children: DNA match identifies human remains found stuffed in garment bag 45 years ago

image.altText: A man is lowered into a mine shaft

items.synopsis: Pictures document a painstaking search for clues in WA's remote Mid-West region, as police return to theÂ century-old mineshaft where the body of an amateur prospector was found eight years ago.Â

title.children: Police dig up mine shaft in hope of solving baffling WA outback murder mystery
